issues.description: The problem statement uses a different method name style for the total-students method in one place: line 41 refers to get_total_number_of_students() (snake_case), whereas the UML, test names and both template/solution use getTotalNumberOfStudents() (camelCase). This inconsistency in the problem text can confuse students about the exact method name/signature they should implement and may lead them to implement the wrong name and fail automated checks.
issues.suggested_fix: Edit the problem statement to use the camelCase name getTotalNumberOfStudents() consistently (replace the occurrence of get_total_number_of_students()). Ensure all textual references match the UML method name so students implement the correct method signature.

issues.description: The problem statement uses a snake_case identifier `get_total_number_of_students()` (line 40) while the UML, template comments, and the solution use the camelCase method name `getTotalNumberOfStudents()`. This inconsistent naming for the same conceptual method can confuse students about the exact method name they should implement and how it is referenced in the template/tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the problem statement with the code by replacing `get_total_number_of_students()` with the camelCase name `getTotalNumberOfStudents()` so it matches the UML, template comments, and solution implementation.
